security: Revealing that the CIA uses State Department cover for its personnel could compromise operations and damage the CIA's reputation. Quoting directly: “Subject will be under State Department cover as a contractor for the language school.”
summary: A memo indicates that Boris Tarasoff was selected as an interpreter for a Soviet Delegation under State Department cover and that no security objections were raised.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential memorandum, dated 13 February 1962, records that Boris Tarasoff was chosen to serve as an interpreter for a visiting Soviet Delegation. Mr. Sounitza from 00/C notified the author, R.C. Svendiman, that the selection had been made with Mr. Kuhn's approval, referencing a new exchange program under negotiation. The memo also specifies that Tarasoff's involvement will be managed under State Department cover, designating him as a contractor for the language school, with no security objections to his use.
title: TARASOFF, Boris
